lines.text: I think there's some deeper-seated thing which crosses the sex boundary of understanding life by building something that is lifelike.
If you analyze it too much, life becomes almost meaningless.
[On pointing the four legs of a chair in a lion's face]
"Eat the man in the white pants."
That's the bottom line. If you're not scared of them, you're in big trouble.
This is all done from memory. If you know what a animal looks like, you just, well, you just start making an animal.
